reviews.review_msg: She's an amazing prof. Helps all students as much as she can and is super caring. One of my favorite profs in SFU.
She is very understanding and will help you out. The class content was quite hard so don't miss classes.
Super good teacher with passionate and patience. Always loves to communicate with students and being very helpful. My favorite prof in sfu <3

she's unclear about what she wanted. insisted that she sent the materials to me beforehad but I did not get it AT ALL. when i did not follow her instructions she blamed on me. very condescening. and no, she's not even a professor. does she have a phd? no. where does the pride come from?

I took FREN221 and FREN222 with her. She cares a lot about the students, but is often quite disorganised. Her notes aren't the clearest, so you have to organise a lot of them yourself. Thankfully, she's very patient and understanding, though she has had bad mood days. VERY TOUGH ON GRAMMAR - if you struggle with it, you will struggle in this course
I liked her, she cares for her students but is sort of a hard prof.. I don't know..  She isn't the clearest about what she's waiting for but makes the effort to be.
Very confusing instructions, but really wants us to do well.
She is such an amazing prof!!  Kinda strict but that's because she wants u to do well.  I really enjoyed her class and she is such a lovely lady.  The *best* fr prof imho.
Soooooo Awesome hahaha.

The stuff she teaches is not much compare to the other instructors. She teaches alright, but you may want to preview before classes. It does get challenging once she lets you speak right after she teaches you the dialogues once. Review and learn everyday, otherwise don't expect a very good grade.

She is one of the most honest, fair and caring profs out there. She is straightforward about her explanations for the class but is constantly working to ensure that each and every student gets the help and attention he or she needs. Although I'm not continuing with French I do wish I could have a class with her again!

Totally misjudged her on the first class, she tried making fun of me but basically i told her off. However throught the semester she was very very nice and helpful. She also taught us french revolution history (student rights!) and customs in france (20-30 min all together). She's nice when you get to know her. I would take her again Oui!
She has an attitude problem and is impatient with her students. She talks too fast, and is terribly disorganized,  MALORGANISÃ©! Unless if you are a french pro, don't bother with her.

Catherine is by far my favourite teacher at SFU! She's fun, she'll joke with you and she really helps you practice your french. She's kind of like the "Fun Aunt". She is frank, which in some teachers may be intimidating, but my experiences with her are all good and i take her advice to heart. A+
Overall, one of the best in the French department. Very lively classes, material was communicated clearly, grading was mostly fair. I really enjoyed Madame Blancard!

The best prof I've ever had! The class was tough, but she was always there to help, and most importantly able to explain things in different ways. Also, she designs the class for what the students want to take from it. Fantastic teacher! Take a course with her if you can!
No Comments
You want to learn French and have fun? Then Cathrine is the right prof for you!

Lovely Lady, as everyone else has mentioned, helpful, kind, positive attitude, her classes are uctually fun, as fun as any french course could possibly get. Even if sick, she comes to school with a smile on her face, ready to go - always!
High expectations but lots of help available. Very receptive to comments, really tries to help each person understand as opposed to just blathering on. Watch grammar and anglicismes.
By far one of the best teachers I have ever had.  very experienced, helpful, insightful, entertaining, understanding, and encouraging.

i was fortunate to have her as my french teacher for many french courses. a teacher full of enthousiasme, passion for teaching, willingess to help, fun, smile etc. but sometimes it's hard to follow her classes, for she didn't tell us where she was talking about when going over the homework.
Very good prof, who loves chocolate ;) hint hint... Best french teacher i've had in my life... NO JOKE!

Prof Blanchard is wonderful- the best french teacher in the department. She cares so much about her students. Always willing to help even if i am not in her class at the moment. if you have a chance to have her as a prof, take the class! She is well worth it!
She is a good, dedicated teacher whi is passionate about her profession and life in general. She is very very understanding and kind, just stay on her good side. She is great!!
Catherine's not too bad...she is definitely a hard marker all around, but it's b/c she expects a lot from her students. She's humerous and enjoyable. No complaints.
absolutely the best french teacher I ever got at sfu. Explains everything, nice funky hair and interesting style :) Great attitude. Actually makes you like french!!

ahh.. catherine.. shes delightful. I absolutely recommend her to anyone taking french. She's hilarious. She's also so willing to help if you go to her that is. Attend class and participate, even if you are wrong, she loves those who try..
She's very friendly.  Lots of fun.  Learned a lot.  An enjoyble course.
Notes in class are very scattered and messy.  Disorganization is low point of class: GOOD LUCK...
She hated me. Made me cry more than once. Clam up in her class and laugh at her anecdotes... whatever you do, stay on her sunny side.
nice
her suit case sounded like a tank! she's very nice though! gave us more extra exercises, helpful ones. her stories are funny, straighforward~ encourage ppl 2 think outside the boxes...

She is very funny and really does care about the students.  She believes are dollars are valuable.  She sees grammar as an explanation of the culture and includes lots of great stories.  She is always available for extra help.  Take any of her courses!
one of my favourite profs so far! she is super nice and really cares about her students.
I didn't understand a thing in class, but she REALLY cared for me.  Super nice prof.
She's very funny and cool.  Very helpfull and just plain fun.  Probably the best teacher @ SFU as far as I know
No Comments
pretty nice and fair. believes that WE ARE THE FUTURE!
Very high-school type teacher. Nice, but strict.
